definition: To forcefully twist or squeeze something with great effort, typically referring to the action of applying pressure to extract liquid or to remove moisture from an object. It is commonly used to describe the act of wringing out wet clothes or towels to remove excess water.

examples.german: Er wringt das nasse Tuch aus.
examples.english: He wrings out the wet cloth.

examples.german: Sie wringen ihre Hände vor Sorge.
examples.english: They wring their hands in worry.

examples.german: Der Dieb wrang das Geld aus dem Safe.
examples.english: The thief wrung the money out of the safe.

examples.german: Sie wrang sich durch die enge Lücke.
examples.english: She wriggled through the narrow gap.
